intro: Sanicula tienmuensis var. tienmuensis, commonly known as the Tienmu Sanicula, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
